definition[0]: if you hold to a belief, principle, promise etc, you believe it or behave according to it
example[0]: He admitted he did not hold to the traditional view of God.
definition[1]: to make someone do what they have promised
example[1]: ‘I’ll ask him tomorrow.’ ‘OK, but I’m going to hold you to that.’
definition[2]: to prevent your opponent in a sports game from getting more than a particular number of points
example[2]: Norway held Holland to a 2–2 draw.
